bookinfo.title: Developing the Linguistic Atlas Projects Web Site

preface.title: Introduction
preface.para: This document describes the Linguistic Atlas Projects web site from a developer's point of view. This involves a description of the architecture of the site, a description of how to set up a Windows machine to work on the site, and a description of how to deploy the site.

preface.title: Overview
preface.para: This section describes the various parts of the Atlas web site. It looks at how each part is organized and how it interacts with the other entities that comprise the site. First, there is the programming code that creates the site, whether the database or the static or dynamic pages. Second, it looks at the template system used to create the pages (again, both static and dynamic). Third, this looks specifically at how static pages are created and organized on the site. Finally, this looks at how dynamic pages are created and organized.
